instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Im back with another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. First time I tryin to fix quarter fan spin repeat so not sure where to start.
No sign of water damage.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 4.95V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: History? <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03 checked? CPU Vcore not pulsing high as fan comes on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: no vcore at all. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> going up and down. shows short to ground after tryin to start but after a some minutes the short is gone

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: The "short" is just residual charge. No answer to the rest of my questions though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
dont have any history on this one. got it in seems to be washed already and just started with this board.

<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> 150K and 12.6V on pin2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
After searching the board I found <RESISTOR>R2193</RESISTOR> missing. Put it back and have fan spin.

Really hate this messed up boards. Have to test everything else now, seems to be some bad soldering around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and lcd connector area and no chime.
